nano.remexp.client
Class ClientGUI

java.lang.Object
  nano.remexp.client.ClientGUI

public class ClientGUI
extends java.lang.Object

This class generates the graphical user interface and handles events coming from user inputs. Those are passed to the main applet class for further processing. It also passes informations coming from the remote experiment broadcaster to the GUI elements which can then react on them if necessary.

Version:
1.1 23.08.2012
Author:
Dominic Bosch

Returns:

createWindow

protected javax.swing.JPanel createWindow(NetObserver myImage,
                                          LineSection myLiner)
This method creates a JPanel which holds all parts of the GUI, i.e.: the logo, the scan image analysis tools, the graphs consisting of a line graph and a top view of the surface of the scanned material and last but not least the controls that allow the interaction between the user and the remote experiment. The client controls are modular and according to gained privileges there are more or less options visible for the client.

Parameters:
myImage - The surface representation of the scanned material.
myLiner - The line graph representation of the scanned material.
Returns:
A JPanel holding the whole GUI.

setupGraphs

protected javax.swing.JPanel setupGraphs(NetObserver myImage,
                                         LineSection myLiner)
Initializes the panel containing both graphs, the whole scan image and the line scan.

Parameters:
myImage - Where the whole image is displayed.
myLiner - Where the last scanned line is displayed.
Returns:
The panel containing the two displays.

getCurrentLine

public int getCurrentLine()
Returns the line that was last scanned by the remote experiment.

Returns:
the index of the last scanned line

setControls

protected void setControls(javax.swing.JPanel controls)
Sets the controls on the GUI. This is used to repaint the GUI if the privilege of the client changed and thus also the controls.

Parameters:
controls - the panel with the new controls

isInitialized

protected boolean isInitialized()
Returns information about whether the applet finished initialization.

Returns:
true if the applet is already initialized, false if not

setPrivilege

protected void setPrivilege(int priv)

Parameters:
priv - the new privilege
